title: What are the best FREE tools to measure the SEO of your web? - Quora

response.answer_text: I am not sure what do you mean by measurement of SEO, but if you meant tools that allow you to see specific metrics that has to do with the way Google ranks your website, there are many tools that can provide Insights for you but most of them are not FREE. Keep in mind that FREE tools are not that great, and some of the following tools can give you the insights you seek on your SEO. I can tell you that if you are focused on Google search engine you might want to check your SEO metrics with Google Search Console and Google Analytics and you may also find it useful to check the different metrics with external tools. Now these lists are only the tools I use, I encourage you to go and research to find the tools that are best for you.  Link metric tools:1. Marketing Search Engine and SEO Backlink Checker - Majestic - Paid2.Open Site Explorer: Link Research & Backlink Checker - MOZ - Paid3. Backlink Checker & SEO Report - Ahrefs - Paid4. Rapid becomes Searchmetrics Essentials.- SearchMetrics - Paid Loading time & Performance tools:1. PageSpeed Insights - Google Pagespeed - Free2. Official Open Source Project Website - Yslow - Free3. Website Speed and Performance Optimization - GtMetrix - Free4. Website Performance and Optimization Test - WebPageTest - Free Structure and Onsite Optimization tools:1. DeepCrawl - Delivering SEO Confidence - DeepCrawl - Paid2. Screaming Frog SEO Spider Tool & Crawler Software - ScreamingFrog - Free3. Create HTML and XML Sitemaps - Paid4. Find broken links on your site with Xenu's Link Sleuth (TM) - Xenu - Free You can use many of these tools to spy on your competitors and check their metrics also, if you want to get a lot of insights on competitors I suggest using SimilarWeb.com - Competitive Intelligence Tool which gives you a lot of good insights.

Ruler Analytics is pretty cool They're currently offering a FREE 30 Day Trial It's just like Google Analytics although it offers more features: Company Report - See what companies have been visiting your websitePhone Call Tracking - Playback all your phone calls using the phone tracking feature ALSO see the keyword they used to generate the callIndividual Visits - Observe each INDIVIDUAL visitor on your website - look at their journey i.e monitor how many pages a visitors checks out before they leave.This really helps with my online Marketing Sales And Marketing Analytics

Actually there are lots of free tools on the net. But you should notice that most of free tools have limited features to check out your SEO in details. Regarding my experience, it is better to select some all-in-one tools based on your SEO needs and get paid version in order to get more accurate and detailed results on your web.  My favourite tools are Google Keyword Planner ( for keyword research), Mention (for brand monitoring), Ahrefs (for backlink monitoring), SE Ranking (for website rankings and website audit) and Piktochart (for inforgraphics creation).

I don’t think there’s something as “the best”. There are many on the market. Some have features and metrics that others don’t and vice versa. Many of them are listed in the earlier answers so my tip is the Mangools SEO extension that will help you with the following: SEO metrics (DA, PA, CF, TF)popularity metrics (Alexa, referring IPs, FB shares)backlinks with metrics and anchor textson-page SEO: keywords, keyword density, meta tags, word countoutbound links checker to find any broken links or errorsSERP snippet previewpage speed analysissmart context menu integrationsadvanced features available directly in Google SERPautomatically highlights DF/NF backlinks

I have used many Fake tools. i was frustrated. i am not understanding which tool i use. but when my friend suggest me some tools for SEO checker. Really guys these tools are very helpful for our business. and this is totally free and simple. i will suggest you use it and reply me about this tools.
